marketNews.title: Government Reportedly to Immediately Lift iPhone 16 Sales Ban
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the government and Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) have agreed on terms to lift the ban on the sale of the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia, ending five months of negotiations in which Apple increased its investment offer by 100 times fold to 1 billion US dollars. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the Ministry of Industry will sign a memorandum of understanding with Apple as soon as this week. Neither Apple nor the Ministry of Industry has commented on this report. In addition to the 1 billion US dollar investment, Bloomberg sources stated that Apple will commit to training local people in the company's research and development (R&D) of products. This R&D training will be conducted through programs other than the existing Apple Developer Academy. Bloomberg reported that in the agreement, Apple does not plan to immediately manufacture iPhones in Indonesia. Previously, Bloomberg reported in December 2024 that Apple's 1 billion US dollar investment offer included the construction of an AirTag factory in Batam, targeted to generate 20% of global AirTag production. News regarding the agreement between the government and Apple emerged nearly 2 months after the Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, met with Apple's Vice President of Global Policy, Nick Ammann, in early January 2025. Agus at that time stated that an investment value of 1 billion US dollars was not enough, and urged Apple to build an iPhone component factory in Indonesia to obtain the Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate, which is a requirement for sales permits. Last week, Agus said that Apple had paid an investment debt of 10 million US dollars, which was the remainder of the investment commitment for the 2020-2024 period.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Lifting the iPhone 16 Sales Ban Potentially Boosts Apple Distributor Sales
marketNews.content: Lifting the ban on the sale of the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia potentially boosts the sales of Apple product distributors, such as: $ERAA - Apple products contributed ~46% to total COGS per 9M24. $MAPI - Digimap stores contributed ~16% to sales per 9M24. On today's trading, Tuesday (25/2), the price of ERAA shares strengthened by +3.74%, while MAPI fell by -2.03%.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Reports Indonesian Bond Plan Sparks Fears Over Governance Monetization
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Bank Indonesia's plan to purchase bonds to be issued by the government to fund the development program of 3 million houses per year will further increase concerns about debt monetization and state debt governance. Debt monetization refers to the practice where the government borrows money from the central bank to finance public spending, rather than issuing bonds to private investors or by increasing taxes. Lionel Priyadi, Fixed Income and Macro Strategist at PT Mega Capital, told Bloomberg that the government must clarify the form of these housing bonds. Otherwise, Lionel mentioned that the market will interpret the issuance of these bonds as a potential widening of the budget deficit, which could drive up government bond yields.

marketNews.title: PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry Management Responds to Rumors of Near-Total Shutdown, States Operations Continue as Normal
marketNews.content: The management of PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry said that the company's operations continue as usual and as optimally as possible, following reports that one of Indonesia's largest nickel smelters was cutting production and nearly shutting down its production entirely. PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry management explained that the company is currently undergoing operational management changes, which are expected to strengthen the company's structure in facing future industry challenges. Research from Kontan showed that PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry previously obtained a syndicated loan of 19.32 trillion rupiah or 1.29 billion US dollars with a maturity period of 2023-2028. This loan involved 5 banks, namely BMRI worth 429.98 million US dollars (~6.4 trillion rupiah), BBNI worth 337.41 million US dollars (~5 trillion rupiah), BBCA worth 259.4 million US dollars (~3.9 trillion rupiah), Bank China Construction worth 259.4 million US dollars, and the remainder from Bank KB Bukopin ($BBKP). For information, as of the end of 2024, BMRI recorded loans and financing of 1,671 trillion rupiah, BBNI of 776 trillion rupiah, BBCA of 922 trillion rupiah, and BBKP of 41 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Coal Association Has Not Received Detailed Regulations on DHE SDA Rupiah Conversion Effective March 1
marketNews.content: The Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, Gita Mahyarani, stated on Monday (24/2) that they have not yet received detailed regulations from the government regarding the foreign exchange proceeds from natural resources exports (DHE SDA) that can be converted to rupiah. Meanwhile, DHE that can be converted to rupiah could be a solution for cash flow circulation. Previously, in the revision of the DHE SDA rule which will take effect on March 1, 2025, the government allows exporters to use export foreign exchange proceeds held in special accounts for several purposes, including conversion to rupiah at the same bank for business operations.

marketNews.title: Attorney General's Office Arrests Three Pertamina Unit Executives in Alleged Crude Oil Import Corruption Causing State Losses of Rp 193.7 Trillion
marketNews.content: The Attorney General's Office arrested 3 senior executives at subsidiaries of PT Pertamina on Monday (24/2) on allegations of corruption related to crude oil imports that caused state losses of 193.7 trillion rupiah. The three individuals are Riva Siahaan (President Director of PT Pertamina Patra Niaga), Yoki Firnandi (President Director of PT Pertamina International Shipping), and Sani Dinar Saifuddin (President Director of PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional). The Attorney General's Office stated that the three are suspected of colluding to justify crude oil and fuel imports and violating government regulations that required PT Pertamina to source crude oil from domestic suppliers.

marketNews.title: Unilever plc CEO Hein Schumacher to Step Down March 1, Replaced by CFO Fernando Fernandez
marketNews.content: Unilever plc (LON: ULVR) announced that the company's CEO, Hein Schumacher, will step down from his position on March 1, 2025, and leave the company on May 31, 2025. His position will be replaced by Fernando Fernandez, who currently serves as the company's CFO. Unilever plc stated that there is no change in outlook or medium-term guidance following this announcement.

marketNews.title: IDX Launches New Derivative Product: Foreign Index Futures Contract (KBIA) for Diversification
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) launched a new derivative product named Foreign Index Futures Contract (KBIA) on Tuesday (25/2), aimed at expanding market access and providing portfolio diversification options for investors. In the initial phase, IDX is collaborating with MSCI to launch KBIA with the MSCI Hong Kong Listed Large Cap index as the underlying. According to a report by Antara, KBIA has several advantages, including: 1) it can be utilized to trade foreign exchange effects while remaining an investor in the Indonesian capital market; 2) it can be utilized when the market is bullish or bearish, as investors can take a long or short position; 3) KBIA has a leverage ratio of up to 33x with a contract size of 10,000 rupiah per index point, where the funds needed to transact this product are around 200,000 thousand rupiah; and 4) investors' realized profits are settled in cash within 1 trading day (T+1).

tickerNews.title: BBCA Director General Buys 337,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: $BBCA: The President Director of Bank Central Asia, Jahja Setiaatmadja, purchased 337,000 BBCA shares at an average price of 8,900 rupiah per share on February 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Jahja's ownership in BBCA increased, but remains around 0.03%.

tickerNews.title: BMRI January 2025 Net Profit Rises 4.5% YoY, Driven by Maintained Credit Cost and Credit Growth
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri recorded net profit (bank only) of 4 trillion rupiah in January 2025 (+4.5% YoY, +1.1% MoM), relatively in line with the consensus estimate for 2025 net profit at +5% YoY. This performance was driven by: 1) relatively maintained credit cost (CoC) at 0.52% (vs. January 2024: 0.65%, December 2024: reversal -0.03%); and 2) credit growth of +19.3% YoY (vs. January 2024: +19.6% YoY, December 2024: +20.7% YoY), with the bank-only Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) beginning to improve to 93.7%. On the other hand, Net Interest Margin (NIM) fell again to 4.42% (-8 bps YoY, -59 bps MoM) and operating expenses swelled by +23% YoY along with an increase in labor costs (+26% YoY) and other expenses (+18% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BUKA Controller Buys ~9.7 Billion Shares for Investment Purposes
tickerNews.content: $BUKA: Bukalapak's controller, PT Kreatif Media Karya, purchased ~9.7 billion BUKA shares at an average price of 138 rupiah per share on February 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.3 trillion rupiah, with this transaction intended for investment. Following this transaction, PT Kreatif Media Karya's ownership in BUKA increased from 24.61% to 34.05%. This was a transaction of BUKA shares in the negotiation market that had previously been reported in Stockbit Snips on Monday (24/2).

tickerNews.title: Four HRTA Directors and Commissioners Collectively Buy 1.81 Million Shares for Rp 1.03 Billion
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Four directors and commissioners of Hartadinata Abadi - consisting of Sandra Sunanto, Ong Deny, Fendy Wijaya, and Cuncun Muliawan - each purchased 450,000, 470,000, 450,000, and 440,000 HRTA shares on February 21, 2025. The total value of the four transactions reached 1.03 billion rupiah, with an average price of 566.3 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: MBMA Signs Agreement with Strategic Partner for HPAL Smelter Project in IMIP with $1.8 Billion Value
tickerNews.content: $MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials announced that it has signed an agreement with a strategic partner for the construction of an HPAL smelter with an annual production capacity of 90,000 tons of MHP nickel at the Indonesia Morowali Industrial Park. Construction of the 1.8 billion US dollar smelter began in January 2025 and is targeted to reach the commissioning phase within the next 18 months. The smelter will be operated by MBMA's business entity, PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt, which will process lateritic nickel ore from MBMA's SCM mine in Southeast Konawe, with a commercial agreement lasting for 20 years since commissioning. PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt has already signed a credit facility of up to 1.4 billion US dollars with a tenor of 7 years from Bangkok Bank Public Limited Company, Bank Permata ($BNLI), BMRI, Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI) to support the construction of the smelter project.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Deputy President Director Pandu Sjahrir to Resign After Being Appointed CIO of Danantara Investment Management Agency
tickerNews.content: $TOBA: TBS Energi Utama Deputy President Director, Pandu Sjahrir, stated that he will resign from his position in the company after being appointed Chief Investment Officer at the Danantara Investment Management Agency. Pandu mentioned that he will only step down from positions related to industry and business, but will continue to hold positions within the scope of the organization.

tickerNews.title: POWR Posts Rp 118 Billion Net Profit in 4Q24, Totaling Rp 1.2 Trillion for 2024 (+2.4% YoY)
tickerNews.content: $POWR: Cikarang Listrindo recorded a net profit of 118 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (vs. 3Q24: profit of 551 billion rupiah, 4Q23: loss of 1 billion rupiah). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 1.2 trillion rupiah (+2.4% YoY). Revenue in 4Q24 grew to 2.6 trillion rupiah (+47% QoQ, +25% YoY), resulting in total revenue for 2024 of 8.8 trillion rupiah (+4.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: JSMR Announces Dissolution and Liquidation of Subsidiary PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta to Stop Losses
tickerNews.content: $JSMR: Jasa Marga announced that the company has closed down its subsidiary, PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta, through the mechanism of dissolution followed by liquidation. The remaining assets of PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta amount to approximately 19.3 billion rupiah, which will be distributed to shareholders according to their ownership proportion. JSMR held 99.99% of the shares in PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta as of September 30, 2024. This liquidation is aimed at stopping the losses incurred by PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta.

tickerNews.title: DOID Subsidiary Signs Accordion Facility Up to $250 Million from BBCA
tickerNews.content: $DOID: Delta Dunia Makmur, through its subsidiary, PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama, signed an accordion facility of up to 250 million US dollars from BBCA, consisting of a facility in US dollars up to 75 million US dollars and a facility in rupiah up to approximately 2.9 trillion rupiah. DOID explained that this facility could have a positive impact on the company's financial flexibility.

tickerNews.title: DATA Data: Shareholder Djoni Purchases ~5.2M Shares, Controller Verah Wahyudi S. Wong Increases Stake to 83.57%
tickerNews.content: $DATA: Remala Abadi shareholder, Djoni, purchased ~5.2 million DATA shares at an average price of 1,612 rupiah per share on February 20, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Djoni's ownership in DATA increased from 4.71% to 5.09%. In a separate transaction on the same day, the controller and President Commissioner of DATA, Verah Wahyudi S. Wong, also purchased ~93.1 million DATA shares at an average price of 270 rupiah per share on February 21, 2025, which was 87% lower than DATA's stock price at the exchange close on the same day at 2,120 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 25.1 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Verah's ownership in DATA increased from 76.8% to 83.57%.

tickerNews.title: BNII Q4 2024 Net Profit Rises 12% YoY to Rp 558 Billion; 2024 Net Profit Down 36% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Maybank Indonesia ($BNII) recorded a net profit of 558 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +30% QoQ), resulting in a net profit for 2024 of 1.1 trillion rupiah (-36% YoY). On the top-line, Net Interest Income (NII) decreased to 1.8 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (-2.7% YoY, -2.1% QoQ), so that NII for 2024 decreased to 7.1 trillion rupiah (-1.8% YoY). This decrease was also reflected in the Net Interest Margin (NIM) for 2024, which was recorded down to 4.37% (-59 bps YoY). On the other hand, operating expenses grew by +8.5% YoY, suppressing Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) down by -15% YoY during 2024. Provision expenses also increased by +23% YoY. Meanwhile, BNII recorded credit growth of +10% YoY in 2024 (vs. 2023: +7.6% YoY).

tickerNews.title: APEX Secures $4.8 Million Seabed Drilling Contract from Pertamina Hulu Mahakam
tickerNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta ($APEX) announced that it has secured a contract worth 4.8 million US dollars from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for offshore drilling work in the Mahakam Delta area, East Kalimantan, for a duration of 3 months.

tickerNews.title: SOSS Controller Increases Stake by 0.5% via Purchase; PT Inlife Sells Same Amount
tickerNews.content: The controller of Shield On Service ($SOSS), PT Alsok Bass Indonesia Security Services, purchased approximately 4 million SOSS shares at an average price of 590 rupiah per share on February 12, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Alsok Bass Indonesia Security Services' ownership in SOSS increased from 79.33% to 79.83%. In a separate transaction on the same day, SOSS shareholder, PT Inlife, sold SOSS shares amounting to the same number and average price as the purchase transaction by PT Alsok Bass Indonesia Security Services. Following this transaction, PT Inlife's ownership in SOSS decreased from 5% to 4.5%.
